intro: Agrostis breviglumis, commonly known as the shortawn fescue, is a perennial grass species native to North America. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wet meadows and stream banks. The plant has fine,丛生的 leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Its botanical features include narrow, grass-like leaves and a fibrous root system. Agrostis breviglumis is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soils and support local biodiversity.
